data.short_desc: HDFC Bank Ltd stock price: HDFC Bank Ltd shares closed 0.09% lower at ₹1,444.85 in the previous trading session. The market capitalisation of the HDFC Bank Ltd was ₹10.97 Lakh Cr. The stock’s 52-week high and 52-week low stood at ₹1,757.50 and ₹1,380.25 respectivey
data.title: US launches airstrike against Islamic State in Afghanistan after Kabul blasts
data.image_caption: All the 32 accused individuals in the Babri Masjid Demolition case have been acquitted by the special CBI court.

description.value: Israel’s military chief on Monday (local time) stated that the country will respond to Iran’s weekend attack and is waiting for a decision from Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu amid fears of escalation in the Middle East crisis.Meanwhile, Iran said it will "respond in seconds" to any strikes from Israel and would even deploy "weapons never used before" if necessary.

The Israeli military chief, Herzi Halevi, stressed that Israel is considering its next steps and that the April 13 Iranian strike, “will be met with a response", whileDeputy Foreign Minister of Iran for Political Affairs, Ali Bagheri Kan, asserted that the response speed from Iran "will be less than a few seconds."

On April 13, Iran launched a direct attack on its arch-foe Israel for the first time, firing more than 300 missiles and drones. This attack came in response to a deadly April 1 airstrike on Tehran’s consulate building in Syria’s capital, Damascus, which was widely blamed on Israel.

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: Senior lawyer and member of the All India Muslim Personal Law Board (AIMPLB) Zafaryab Jilani on Wednesday said the verdict of a special court acquitting all the 32 accused in the Babri mosque demolition case would be challenged in the high court.There were hundreds of statements by the witnesses and in criminal cases these are very important, Jilani said, adding that among those who gave their statements were IPS officers and journalists who had said that the accused persons were sitting on the dias and inflammatory speeches were being given.
blog_content.desc_withhtml:
Senior lawyer and member of the All India Muslim Personal Law Board (AIMPLB) Zafaryab Jilani on Wednesday said the verdict of a special court acquitting all the 32 accused in the Babri mosque demolition case would be challenged in the high court.

There were hundreds of statements by the witnesses and in criminal cases these are very important, Jilani said, adding that among those who gave their statements were IPS officers and journalists who had said that the accused persons were sitting on the dias and inflammatory speeches were being given.
blog_content.title: Babri mosque verdict will be challenged in high court: Zafaryab Jilani

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: All-India Muslim Personal Law Board senior member Maulana Khalid Rasheed Firangi Mahali on Wednesday said organisations representing the community will together decide whether they need to challenge or not the CBI court verdict in the Babri mosque demolition case.
blog_content.desc_withhtml: All-India Muslim Personal Law Board senior member Maulana Khalid Rasheed Firangi Mahali on Wednesday said organisations representing the community will together decide whether they need to challenge or not the CBI court verdict in the Babri mosque demolition case.
blog_content.title: Muslim bodies to collectively decide on challenging Babri case verdict: Firangi Mahali

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: "The acquittals amount to a travesty of justice. It took 28 long years for this verdict but not justice to be delivered. All the top leaders of the BJP-VHP-RSS who were present at the scene guiding the criminal act have been found to be innocent of the charge of conspiracy to demolish the mosque,"  the CPI(M) politburo said in a statement.
blog_content.desc_withhtml: "The acquittals amount to a travesty of justice. It took 28 long years for this verdict but not justice to be delivered. All the top leaders of the BJP-VHP-RSS who were present at the scene guiding the criminal act have been found to be innocent of the charge of conspiracy to demolish the mosque," the CPI(M) politburo said in a statement.
blog_content.title: Acquittal of all accused in Babri demolition case travesty of justice: CPI(M)

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: The RSS on Wednesday welcomed the special CBI court's verdict acquitting all accused in the Babri masjid demolition case and called for harmony in society to face challenges before the country."Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh welcomes the special CBI court's decision to acquit all the accused in the demolition of the controversial structure."After this decision, all sections of the society should come together in unity and harmony and work successfully to face the challenges before the country, and work towards the progress of this country," RSS general secretary Suresh 'Bhaiyyaji' Joshi tweeted.
blog_content.desc_withhtml:
The RSS on Wednesday welcomed the special CBI court's verdict acquitting all accused in the Babri masjid demolition case and called for harmony in society to face challenges before the country.

"Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh welcomes the special CBI court's decision to acquit all the accused in the demolition of the controversial structure.

"After this decision, all sections of the society should come together in unity and harmony and work successfully to face the challenges before the country, and work towards the progress of this country," RSS general secretary Suresh 'Bhaiyyaji' Joshi tweeted.
blog_content.title: RSS welcomes Babri case verdict, calls for harmony

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: BJP MP Bhupendar Yadav said, "Truth has a way of presenting itself no matter how hard those opposed to the truth may try. The Babri Verdict proves it yet again. All accused acquitted in the Babri demolition case. Court says demolition was a spur of the moment act.The Karseva of 06.12.1992 had the permission of the SC. All of a sudden, a group of stray people consisting of some..broke the barricades, defying the orders and request of the organisers, and moved towards the disputed structure."

All of a sudden, a group of stray people consisting of some..broke the barricades, defying the orders and request of the organisers, and moved towards the disputed structure."
blog_content.title: Stray group of people broke barricades...: BJP MP Bhupendar Yadav says truth won in Babri demolition verdict

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: On the role of Kalyan Singh: No evidence that Singh as CM did not do his duty to ensure security to the disputed area. Evidence shows that security was provided but there were lakhs of karsevaks in the area and a group turned violent. Announcements were made from the stage to maintain peace. No evidence to show that Kalyan Singh or LK Advani were involved in the conspiracy to demolish the mosque.	Court notes that evidence was not properly preserved or even examined in the Babri demolition case: Photographs are unlabeled. Newspaper reporters questioned but documents and records not taken by CBI. Pieces of demolished structure not preserved properly which makes it difficult to establish how it was damaged.	Details of speeches made by Kalyan Singh not on record.	Court has rejected eyewitness statement by BSP local leader Nusrat Quddusi: Court has said that Quddusi's eyewitness account contains exaggeration. Has changed statement and not given any evidence to support his claim	Statement of eyewitness Avdesh Kumar Upadhyay that political leaders made speeches and distributed sweets from the dais calling for the demolition of the masjid: Court notes that the eyewitness has not named any specific leader. Has said there was a lot of dust and crowd. No evidence of which leader was on the stage and who distributed sweets.	Eyewitness Haji Mehboob statement rejected by the court: Contains contradictions. At one point claims to have seen Advani at the stage, then says Advani left. His statement in the Chargesheet does not mention that he specifically identified any political leader.
blog_content.desc_withhtml:
1. On the role of Kalyan Singh: No evidence that Singh as CM did not do his duty to ensure security to the disputed area. Evidence shows that security was provided but there were lakhs of karsevaks in the area and a group turned violent. Announcements were made from the stage to maintain peace. No evidence to show that Kalyan Singh or LK Advani were involved in the conspiracy to demolish the mosque.
  2. Court notes that evidence was not properly preserved or even examined in the Babri demolition case: Photographs are unlabeled. Newspaper reporters questioned but documents and records not taken by CBI. Pieces of demolished structure not preserved properly which makes it difficult to establish how it was damaged.
  3. Details of speeches made by Kalyan Singh not on record.
  4. Court has rejected eyewitness statement by BSP local leader Nusrat Quddusi: Court has said that Quddusi's eyewitness account contains exaggeration. Has changed statement and not given any evidence to support his claim
  5. Statement of eyewitness Avdesh Kumar Upadhyay that political leaders made speeches and distributed sweets from the dais calling for the demolition of the masjid: Court notes that the eyewitness has not named any specific leader. Has said there was a lot of dust and crowd. No evidence of which leader was on the stage and who distributed sweets.
  6. Eyewitness Haji Mehboob statement rejected by the court: Contains contradictions. At one point claims to have seen Advani at the stage, then says Advani left. His statement in the Chargesheet does not mention that he specifically identified any political leader.
blog_content.title: Here is what the 2,300-page Babri Masjid demolition verdict says

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: Congress' chief spokesperson Randeep Surjewala urged the central and state governments to file an appeal against the decision of the special court. "The decision of the Special Court to acquit all the accused in Babri Masjid demolition case runs counter to Supreme Court judgement as also the constitutional spirit," Surjewala said.
blog_content.desc_withhtml: Congress' chief spokesperson Randeep Surjewala urged the central and state governments to file an appeal against the decision of the special court. "The decision of the Special Court to acquit all the accused in Babri Masjid demolition case runs counter to Supreme Court judgement as also the constitutional spirit," Surjewala said.
blog_content.title: Verdict in Babri case runs counter to SC judgment, constitutional spirit, says Congress

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: Calling the Babri verdict shocking, Congress leader Ahmed Patel said the judgment goes “contrary to principles of natural justice and even the SC’s observation.”
blog_content.desc_withhtml: Calling the Babri verdict shocking, Congress leader Ahmed Patel said the judgment goes “contrary to principles of natural justice and even the SC’s observation.”
blog_content.title: Babri verdict shocking: Ahmed Patel

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: The CBI will decide on filing an appeal against the special court verdict acquitting all 32 accused in the Babri Masjid demolition case after consulting the legal department, its counsel said on Wednesday."After a copy of today's verdict is received, it would be sent to the CBI headquarters where it would be studied by the legal department and a decision on filing an appeal would be taken as per its suggestion," CBI counsel Lalit Singh said.
blog_content.desc_withhtml:
The CBI will decide on filing an appeal against the special court verdict acquitting all 32 accused in the Babri Masjid demolition case after consulting the legal department, its counsel said on Wednesday.

"After a copy of today's verdict is received, it would be sent to the CBI headquarters where it would be studied by the legal department and a decision on filing an appeal would be taken as per its suggestion," CBI counsel Lalit Singh said.
blog_content.title: CBI to decide on challenging verdict after consulting legal department: Counsel

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: The Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) has welcomed today's verdict in the Babri Masjid demolition case, saying the verdict is a "victory of truth and justice"."Devotees of Lord Ram have waited patiently and with courage for this verdict for 28 years," the VHP said in a statement."Even though the courts took 28 years to decide this case, we hope that this verdict will lead to closure of issues that have distressed the Hindu people for 472 years," it said.
blog_content.desc_withhtml:
The Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) has welcomed today's verdict in the Babri Masjid demolition case, saying the verdict is a "victory of truth and justice".

"Devotees of Lord Ram have waited patiently and with courage for this verdict for 28 years," the VHP said in a statement.

"Even though the courts took 28 years to decide this case, we hope that this verdict will lead to closure of issues that have distressed the Hindu people for 472 years," it said.
blog_content.title: Today's verdict is victory of truth and justice, says VHP

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala has said the party hopes that the central government will file an appeal against the CBI special court's verdict in the Babri Masjid demolition case."Decision of the special court today to acquit all accused runs counter to the constitutional spirit. It (demolition of Babri Masjid) was a deep-rooted political conspiracy to destroy the country's brotherhood. The then BJP government in UP had given an affidavit but it failed to uphold it. The Supreme Court had termed the demolition as a violation of law of the land," Surjewala said.
blog_content.desc_withhtml:
Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala has said the party hopes that the central government will file an appeal against the CBI special court's verdict in the Babri Masjid demolition case.

"Decision of the special court today to acquit all accused runs counter to the constitutional spirit. It (demolition of Babri Masjid) was a deep-rooted political conspiracy to destroy the country's brotherhood. The then BJP government in UP had given an affidavit but it failed to uphold it. The Supreme Court had termed the demolition as a violation of law of the land," Surjewala said.
blog_content.title: Hope Centre will appeal against today's verdict: Congress

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said the CBI special court's verdict in the Babri Masjid demolition case marks a sad and black day in the history of Indian judiciary."The decision by CBI court is a black day for Indian judiciary because the Supreme Court already said in civil property dispute of the site as 'an egregious violation of rule of law' and 'calculated act of destroying a public place of worship'...This is an issue of justice. This is an issue of ensuring that people who are responsible for Babri Masjid demolition should have been convicted. But they have been politically rewarded in the past by becoming home minister and HRD minister. BJP is in power because of this issue. Now, the court says there was no conspiracy. Please enlighten me, how many days of months of preparations are required to disqualify an action from being spontaneous?"Today is a sad day in the history of Indian judiciary. Now, the court says there was no conspiracy. Please enlighten me, how many days of months of preparations are required to disqualify an action from being spontaneous?: Asaduddin Owaisi, on the #BabriMasjidDemolitionVerdict pic.twitter.com/iMumkda50l— ANI (@ANI) September 30, 2020
blog_content.desc_withhtml:
AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said the CBI special court's verdict in the Babri Masjid demolition case marks a sad and black day in the history of Indian judiciary.

"The decision by CBI court is a black day for Indian judiciary because the Supreme Court already said in civil property dispute of the site as 'an egregious violation of rule of law' and 'calculated act of destroying a public place of worship'...This is an issue of justice. This is an issue of ensuring that people who are responsible for Babri Masjid demolition should have been convicted. But they have been politically rewarded in the past by becoming home minister and HRD minister. BJP is in power because of this issue. Now, the court says there was no conspiracy. Please enlighten me, how many days of months of preparations are required to disqualify an action from being spontaneous?"

Today is a sad day in the history of Indian judiciary. Now, the court says there was no conspiracy. Please enlighten me, how many days of months of preparations are required to disqualify an action from being spontaneous?: Asaduddin Owaisi, on the #BabriMasjidDemolitionVerdict pic.twitter.com/iMumkda50l

— ANI (@ANI) September 30, 2020
blog_content.title: Black day in history of Indian judiciary, says Asaduddin Owaisi

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: Taking to Twitter, CPI(M)'s Sitaram Yechury called the verdict a travesty of justice. “A complete travesty of Justice. All charged with criminal conspiracy to demolish Babri Masjid acquitted. It self imploded? The Constitution Bench headed by then CJI had said that demolition was an “egregious” violation of law. Now this verdict! Shame,” Sitaram Yechury wrote on Twitter.
blog_content.desc_withhtml: Taking to Twitter, CPI(M)'s Sitaram Yechury called the verdict a travesty of justice. “A complete travesty of Justice. All charged with criminal conspiracy to demolish Babri Masjid acquitted. It self imploded? The Constitution Bench headed by then CJI had said that demolition was an “egregious” violation of law. Now this verdict! Shame,” Sitaram Yechury wrote on Twitter.
blog_content.title: Sitaram Yechury: A complete travesty of justice

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: LK Advani, one of the prime accused in the Babri Masjid demolition case, hailed the special CBI court's judgement as historic after it acquitted 32 persons accused in the case. He said, "A historic judgment by the court and a day of happiness for all of us.""I wholeheartedly welcome the judgement by the Special Court in Babri Masjid demolition case. The judgement vindicates my personal and BJP's belief and commitment toward the Ram Janmabhoomi movement," added.The special CBI court acquitted other prominent leaders like MM Joshi and Uma Bharti as well. The court's verdict came almost 28 years after the Babri Masjid was demolished by a mob of kar sevaks.
blog_content.desc_withhtml:
LK Advani, one of the prime accused in the Babri Masjid demolition case, hailed the special CBI court's judgement as historic after it acquitted 32 persons accused in the case. He said, "A historic judgment by the court and a day of happiness for all of us."

"I wholeheartedly welcome the judgement by the Special Court in Babri Masjid demolition case. The judgement vindicates my personal and BJP's belief and commitment toward the Ram Janmabhoomi movement," added.

The special CBI court acquitted other prominent leaders like MM Joshi and Uma Bharti as well. The court's verdict came almost 28 years after the Babri Masjid was demolished by a mob of kar sevaks.
blog_content.title: LK Advani hails verdict as historic, says day of happiness for all of us

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: Many Bhartiya Janata Party (BJP) leaders have reacted after the verdict was announced in the Babri Masjid demolition case. BJP leader Ram Madhav said, "Truth triumphs. CBI court’s acquittal in Babri conspiracy case was long overdue. A malicious case against some of the most respected leaders of our nation has fallen aside finally after 3 decades. Everyone should welcome d judgement."UP Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath also welcomed the verdict and said that truth has triumphed. Meanwhile, Shiv Sena's said he and his party wholeheartedly welcomes the verdict given by the special CBI court in the Babri Masjid demolition case.
blog_content.desc_withhtml:
Many Bhartiya Janata Party (BJP) leaders have reacted after the verdict was announced in the Babri Masjid demolition case. BJP leader Ram Madhav said, "Truth triumphs. CBI court’s acquittal in Babri conspiracy case was long overdue. A malicious case against some of the most respected leaders of our nation has fallen aside finally after 3 decades. Everyone should welcome d judgement."

UP Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath also welcomed the verdict and said that truth has triumphed. Meanwhile, Shiv Sena's said he and his party wholeheartedly welcomes the verdict given by the special CBI court in the Babri Masjid demolition case.
blog_content.title: Political reactions start flooding in, BJP leaders hail verdict

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: The special CBI court on Wednesday acquitted all 32 individuals accused in the Babri Masjid demolition case almost 28 years after the Mughal-era structure was razed to the ground by thousands of kar sevaks. Prominent names like Murli Manohar Joshi, LK Advani and Uma Bharti, who were key accused of instigating the mob of kar sevaks, have been acquitted. In its verdict, the special CBI court said that the demolition was not pre-planned and ruled out all conspiracy theories which could have led to the demolition of Babri Masjid. CBI court judge SK Yadav said there was no conspiracy in the act and that it happened during the spur of the moment.
blog_content.desc_withhtml: The special CBI court on Wednesday acquitted all 32 individuals accused in the Babri Masjid demolition case almost 28 years after the Mughal-era structure was razed to the ground by thousands of kar sevaks. Prominent names like Murli Manohar Joshi, LK Advani and Uma Bharti, who were key accused of instigating the mob of kar sevaks, have been acquitted. In its verdict, the special CBI court said that the demolition was not pre-planned and ruled out all conspiracy theories which could have led to the demolition of Babri Masjid. CBI court judge SK Yadav said there was no conspiracy in the act and that it happened during the spur of the moment.
blog_content.title: CBI court acquits all 32 accused in Babri Masjid demolition case
